Articles.Content:
Hi!

I've kind of run into a slight roadblock on my quest to take over the universe peacefully colonize space.

I'm trying to figure out a way SAFELY bring a rover w/ manned lander to a planet (or Mun).

My current situation involves a rather awkward contraption with massive arms with attached rovers jutting off the center lander with legs and an unacceptable amount of struts. I've seen methods of attaching rovers to the side of the landers, but I cannot figure out how to do that.

Please and thank you

Edited July 9, 2013 by Nabiscovinco

Seeing as I've replied in one thread about exactly this and seen the same question asked a few times I thought I'd just hit you up with some links from the forum search.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/38829-Putting-a-rover-on-a-lander

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/37808-Rover-Lander-design

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/33696-Lander-and-Rover-Is-there-a-better-way-to-do-it

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/32050-How-to-get-a-lander-rover-to-the-Mun

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/31428-Rover-Lander-Construction-Tutorial-Request

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/30724-Tips-to-land-a-rover-with-a-lander
I had a feeling this was already asked... Thank you!
